article.title: Andreas_Aagesen
article.paragraph: Image:Aagesen-akademisk-vaerge.jpgthumbAndreas AagesenAndreas Aagesen(5 August 1826  26 October 1879) was aDenmarkDanishjurist.
article.heading: Biography
article.paragraph: Aagesen was educated for the law at Christiania (nowOslo) andCopenhagen, and interrupted his studies in 1848 to take part in theFirst Schleswig War, in which he served as the leader of a reserve battalion.sfnBain19112

In 1855 Aagesen became a professor ofjurisprudenceat theUniversity of Copenhagen. In 1870 he was appointed a member of the commission for drawing up a maritime and commercial code, and the navigation law of 1882 is mainly his work. In 1879 he was elected a member of theLandsting (Denmark)Landsting(one of two chambers of the Danish Parliament, theRigsdagen); but it is as a teacher at the university that he won his reputation. Aagesen wasCarl Christian Hall's successor as lecturer onRoman lawat the university, and in this department his research was epoch-making.sfnBain19112
